main event: A motorist observed an unidentified oval-shaped object hovering about 50 feet off the ground, which caused his car's engine to stop functioning until the object moved away.
interesting points: The object was observed near the Pink Hill Grocery store south of Lake City Arsenal in Missouri.
The sighting occurred around 1 a.m. on November 2, 1957.
The motorist, whose name is redacted, was driving from his workplace in the Kansas City area to his home when he saw the object.
The motorist did not initially intend to report the sighting, thinking that no one would believe him.
This report was third-hand information, with little additional details provided for evaluation.
location: near the Pink Hill Grocery store, south of Lake City Arsenal, Missouri
